entry.title: Re: Timestamp to DATS (with user timezone) in Custom CDS...
entry.content:
Hi,

S/4 Public Cloud help page (08.2025) regarding Custom CDS View App mentions a limited list of functions which may give an incorrect idea of the app's capability.  I've come to realize that we can use all ABAP CDS functions for calculations. 

For calculating Date or Time from Timestamp (DEC 15), we can use the following:

Date: tstmp_to_dats( <timestamp>,  <timezone>, <client>, <on_error>)

Time: tstmp_to_tims( <timestamp>,  <timezone>, <client>, <on_error>)

We can use following values for timezone, client, on_error

Timezone: abap_system_timezone( $session.client, 'NULL' )

Clinet = $session.client

on_error = 'NULL' 

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Cloud Foundry Runtime in SAP BTP Trial shows 0 MB mem...
entry.content:
Hi,

Please check the link for similar issue

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/btp-cloud-foundry-consumed-by-all-spaces-exceeds-any-running-applications/qaq-p/14181547

Snippet from it.: Even though the application is stopped, tasks can still be running. We had to run command cf tasks APP-NAME for each app in the CF org. For one of the apps that was stopped, so we didn't think it would have been an issue, there were a series of tasks that were in status RUNNING and each task is consuming 1GB of memory. We're investigating why the task was not finishing successfully but we determined we can cancel the task. 

To cancel the task run command cf terminate-task APP-NAME TASK-ID. 

Afterwards, this cleared the memory consumption issue. 

Regards,

Prithviraj

entry.title: Re: How to Convert Thunderbird Files?
entry.content:
Hi @daisystanley 

Converting Thunderbird files is not simple for anyone. Thunderbird creates backups in MBOX and MSF formats. Both formats save the same number of files, but they don't run on all software, as most software supports the MBOX format. If you have a Thunderbird profile backup and want to import all Thunderbird backups to Outlook, then this task becomes tedious for anyone. In the AI world, there is much software available in the market to convert Thunderbird files. I suggest using the top Thunderbird converter to help you export Thunderbird files.

1. BLR Thunderbird Converter.
2. SysTools Thunderbird Backup Tool.
3. MacUncle Thunderbird Converter for Mac
4. CubexSoft MBOX Converter.

entry.title: Master Blog: SAP Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite Migration – Tool and Guidance
entry.content:
Migration Journey Overview: From Assessment to Tooling

Migrating from SAP Process Orchestration to the SAP Integration Suite represents a significant milestone in your organization’s cloud transformation journey. This master blog serves as a central hub for comprehensive information and guidance related to the Migration Tool and the broader migration process. It provides links to detailed blogs, documentation, and best practices to help you successfully plan and execute your migration to SAP Integration Suite.

Before beginning any migration activity, it’s crucial to start with the Migration Assessment - a key capability of the SAP Integration Suite. The assessment analyses your on-premises landscape, including existing integration configurations, mappings, custom adapters, and dependent objects. It provides detailed insights and a comprehensive overview indicating which scenarios can be migrated as-is, which ones require optimization, and which may need to be redesigned or modernized. This step establishes a clear, data-driven foundation for a successful and efficient migration journey.

Once your Migration Assessment is complete, the next big step is moving your integration content to the cloud - and that’s where the Migration Tool comes into play!

The Migration Tool, built into SAP Integration Suite’s Cloud Integration capability, helps you bring your existing integration scenarios from SAP Process Orchestration to the cloud with ease. Think of it as your Guided workflow for migration - it identifies what can be moved, converts integration artifacts into their cloud-ready counterparts, and helps you streamline the entire process with minimal manual effort.

Migration Tool – Offerings and Supported Components

The Migration Tool comes packed with a set of features to make your move from SAP Process Orchestration to the SAP Integration Suite smoother and faster. Here’s an overview of the key components it supports and automates.

Connectivity to On-Premise Systems: Choose the appropriate connection setup for securely linking your on-premise landscape with the SAP Integration Suite. For detailed configuration options, see Configuring Connectivity to an SAP Process Orchestration System

Object Types: The tool supports migration of integration artifacts such as Integrated Configurations, which define how messages are processed within the Java-only runtime of SAP Process Orchestration systems.

It also supports Receiver Determination, which is available in SAP Process Integration dual-stack installations (from release 7.5 onwards) where message processing takes place on both ABAP and Java stacks.

 

Patterns: The Migration Tool supports a variety of integration patterns to help you transition your existing scenarios to cloud-ready designs. These patterns provide flexibility for different integration needs - whether it’s point-to-point communication, content-based routing, or complex orchestration flows.

For the complete list of supported patterns, refer to the Migration Patterns

Migration Approaches: The Migration Tool offers two approaches - Standard Approach and Pipeline Approach to help you move your integration scenarios efficiently to the cloud. For more details, see Pipeline Concept

 

Communication Channels: The Migration Tool helps move your existing communication channels to the cloud, making sure your integration endpoints and related settings are mapped correctly. A few exceptions may apply, so some channels might need minor adjustments after migration. For more details, see Standard Adapter Migration.

Adapter Module Support: The tool automatically migrates PGP encryption and decryption modules to cloud-compatible configurations. Additional adapter modules are provided through the community package and can be leveraged as needed. The following list provides an overview: Adapter Modules

Decoupling and Ordered Message Processing with JMS Queues: The Migration Tool supports JMS queue configurations to enable decoupled communication between senders and receivers. In SAP Integration Suite Cloud Integration, internal JMS Adapter help separate asynchronous message processing from the sender, allowing messages to be handled independently and reliably.

To ensure messages are processed in the correct order - EOIO, the Access Type should be set to Exclusive, which ensures that only one consumer/worker processes messages from the queue at a time.

Note: This configuration is not applied automatically by the Migration Tool and must be set manually.

Idempotent at Receiver: The tool also provides idempotent message handling at the receiver side. This means it helps prevent duplicate message processing, ensuring that each message is delivered and processed only once - an essential feature for maintaining data consistency.

Reusing Artifacts for Efficient Migration: The Migration Tool provides options for users to reuse existing standalone artifacts - message mappings and function libraries, to their migrated scenarios. This flexibility allows message mappings and other artifacts to be reused across multiple integration scenarios, reducing redundancy and speeding up the migration process.

Example: Enable Reusable Artifacts

 

Migration Summary: After the migration, a detailed summary report provides an overview of all successfully migrated Integration Flow Configurations and their related objects in the cloud. If any object could not be migrated, this information is clearly highlighted in the summary, helping you identify follow-up actions easily.

The Migration Tool does offer a downloadable Summary Report that captures essential migration details - including the on-premise system details, integration patterns used, chosen migration approach, and other key information related to each migrated object, which you can review later if required.

Note: If you’d like to select an alternative runtime profile instead of the default Cloud Integration, you can manually set it in the Integration Runtime configuration after the successful migration of the Integration Flow.

Error Logs: When the Migration Tool cannot migrate to certain integration scenarios, it generates a detailed error log summary. This log provides insights into the specific issues encountered, helping you understand what went wrong and take corrective actions.

Hint: The error log is available to download as a .csv file. You can import it in Excel and use a delimiter as Comma (,) to transform the data, to review and analyse the migration errors effectively check columns ‘Status’ and ‘Message’.

 

For detailed, step-by-step instructions on using the Migration Tool, refer to the official tutorial: Use the Migration Tooling

 

Known Limitations of the Migration Tool

While the Migration Tool covers a wide range of integration scenarios, there are some known gaps and limitations. For the most up-to-date information, refer to Known Limitations of Migration Tooling 

Disclaimer: The list of gaps and limitations may shorten as SAP expands coverage and implements features on its roadmap

 

Next in the Series

Stay tuned for the upcoming posts where we will dive deeper into specific migration scenarios, tips, and best practices to help you get the most out of SAP Integration Suite.

 

References - SAP Documentation and Blogs:

Migration Guide for SAP Process Orchestration

Get Started with Migration to SAP Integration Suite

Assessment Blog: How to use the Migration Assessment Application to get ready to migrate your SAP Process Orchestration Scenarios?

Migration Tool: Migration tool in Cloud Integration Capability of SAP Integration Suite

entry.title: Archiving Write Job for /OPT/DOC Object Taking Too Long
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m working on the OpenText VIM solution integrated with SAP, and I’m facing a performance issue during the /OPT/DOC archiving write job (program: /OPT/ARC_DP_WRITE).

The job is taking around 8–9 hours to process ~40,000 records. After running a performance trace, I observed that about 99.7% of the runtime is consumed on the database, mainly on the table /OPT/VIM_8LOG.

Here are the details:

Table: /OPT/VIM_8LOG
Total Record Count: ~3,540,616
Archiving Period: 1 month
Observation: The trace shows a full table scan on /OPT/VIM_8LOG using `BUS_OBJKEY` (and `MANDT`) to link with the header table `/OPT/VIM_1HEAD`.

It looks like the system is performing a nested loop and clustered table access, causing significant delays.

My questions are:

1. Would creating a secondary index on (MANDT, BUS_OBJKEY) be advisable to improve performance?
2. Has anyone faced a similar issue with /OPT/VIM_8LOG during archiving?


Any guidance or best practices for optimizing this write job would be really helpful.

Thanks,
Snehankita

entry.title: Re: Generate PDF form on S/4HANA Cloud, public edition fr...
entry.content:
Hey @daa,

It is not an authorization issue but rather specific requirement for the OData service consumption, so basically Output Control framework is OData V2 and in that specfic case SAML authentication must be used. That means it is not just one GET request but chain of request to authenticate you.
I would suggest you to use https://github.com/SAP/odata-library to operate with service I mentioned based on the already implemneted logic. Code would be something like:

const pdfStream = await service.odata.readPdfFromDirectUrl("<system>/sap/opu/odata/sap/CA_OC_OUTPUT_REQUEST_SRV/Items(ApplObjectType='TM_FREIGHTORDER',ApplObjectId='00000000006600000978',ItemId='3')/Preview/$value/", <username>, <password>, true);

That method do everything: initialize Odata service with SAML, retrieve the PDF form and then return it back.

Note: I used TM output control, but in your case it could be the different application and item numbering.

Best Regards,
Slava Aliakseyevets

entry.title: Text Object cannot move to X=0 or Y=0 with Snap to Grid enabled — behavior depends on Zoom Level
entry.content:
Product and Version:
    Product: SAP Crystal Reports 2016
    Version: Support Pack 9 Patch 21 (v14.2.9.5104)

Environment Settings:
   Snap to Grid: Checked
   Grid Size: 0.160 cm

Issue Description:
When moving a Text Object using the keyboard arrow keys, it cannot be positioned exactly at X = 0 or Y = 0 under certain Zoom  Levels, even though Snap to Grid is enabled.
This behavior changes depending on the current zoom setting.

Steps to Reproduce:
   Open a report in the Design view.
   Enable Snap to Grid and set Grid Size to 0.160 cm.
   Select a Text Object.
   Use the arrow keys to move it to the far left or top edge of the design area.
   Repeat at different Zoom Levels (100% to 200%).

Observed Behavior:
   The ability to move the object to X=0 or Y=0 changes with zoom level:
   Zoom Level Can move to X=0/Y=0?
     100 % : Yes
     110 % : No
     120 % : Yes
     130 % : No
     140 % : Yes
     150 % : Yes
     160 % : No
     170 % : Yes
     180 % : No
     190 % : Yes
     200 % : Yes

Expected Behavior:
   Regardless of the Zoom Level, the Text Object should be able to align exactly to X=0 or Y=0 when Snap to Grid is enabled.

Question:
   Is this a known issue or limitation?
   If so, is there any fix, patch, or recommended workaround to ensure consistent snapping behavior across all zoom levels?

entry.title: SAP PI/PO Move如何帮助用户迁移到集成套件概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

您的SAP PI/PO系统还能"撑"多久？

 

如果您还在使用本地部署的SAP PI或PO进行系统集成，是否已经感受到维护成本越来越高、技术支持即将到期的压力？当业务部门要求快速对接新系统时，您的团队是否还需要数周甚至数月才能完成？更关键的是，NetWeaver 7.5等版本的维护支持即将结束，您准备好应对技术风险了吗？

SAP PI/PO Move不只是一次简单的系统迁移，而是您摆脱技术债务、拥抱云原生集成能力的战略机遇——让集成从"重负担"变为"新引擎"。

 

PI/PO Move是什么？

SAP PI/PO Move是一套流程，指从本地部署的SAP Process Integration (PI) 或 SAP Process Orchestration (PO) 系统迁移到云端SAP集成套件的全套转型流程，涵盖了从传统中间件平台向云原生集成平台的全面转换

 

SAP设计PI/PO Move流程的目的是什么？

战略层面

通过一站式的现代化集成平台承接所有集成需求，降低客户的技术债务和维护成本

为数字化转型提供现代化的集成基础设施支撑，尤其是在拥抱新技术上

功能层面

没有PI/PO Move时：

  • 维护成本高昂：本地PI/PO系统需要专门的硬件、软件许可和技术人员维护 [4]
  • 技术栈老化：NetWeaver 7.5等版本即将结束维护支持，存在技术风险
  • 扩展性限制：本地部署难以快速响应业务增长和集成需求变化

完成PI/PO Move后：

  • 降低总体拥有成本：云端托管减少基础设施投资和运维开销
  • 获得持续创新：自动获取最新功能更新和安全补丁
  • 提升集成敏捷性：利用预构建连接器和API加速集成开发

 

PI/PO Move使用到了哪些组件，详细流程如何，可以达成什么价值？

SAP针对PI/PO Move的流程设计了全套工具：

  • 集成套件：新一代集成平台，将承接并扩展PI/PO集成能力
  • 集成套件内置的迁移评估工具：通过对接PI/PO测试系统，来自动化分析当前集成内容，哪些可以一键迁移至集成套件，哪些需要简要修改，哪些需要大量修改，并给出分析报表
  • 集成套件内置的迁移执行工具：通过对接PI/PO测试系统，选择有信心的PI/PO集成内容，一键转换为集成套件需要的格式，并存储进集成套件
  • 预定义内容：针对特定集成场景设计，免费下载后只需填入基本的连接，安全信息即可部署

这些工具和能力协同工作，帮助用户完成以下流程：

  • 发现阶段：了解Integration Suite能力，定义集成原则和策略；通过集成套件内置的迁移评估工具评估现有PI/PO系统；
  • 准备阶段：分析评估报表，分析迁移工作量和自动迁移可能性
  • 探索阶段：进行变更影响分析，构建业务案例，制定详细迁移计划
  • 实现阶段：组合迁移执行能力和手动迁移方式完成最终迁移，配置新系统，进行测试验证
  • 部署阶段：渐进式的将接口切换到Integration Suite，确保业务连续性
  • 运行阶段：持续优化和风险管理，跟进最新技术创新，例如事件驱动，API管理等

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法

entry.title: Optimal Planning for Dress Rehearsal Migration in S/4HANA Upgrade Projects in RISE.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

For example, a customer running an older version of S/4HANA on the Private Cloud Edition is considering upgrading to the latest version of S/4HANA in the future.
The customer has numerous add-ons, making a Dress Rehearsal Migration before cutover essential for the project.
In traditional on-premise environments, Dress Rehearsal could be performed by building a dedicated copy system in-house and using a replacement upgrade method.
However, how should this be handled in RISE?

For example, contracting the SAP Safekeeper service allows adding a landscape. Can this environment be used for Dress Rehearsal?
I can only think of the following two approaches.

  1. Perform the production system's Dress Rehearsal Migration on a test machine.
    This means copying the production system's data before upgrading the test machine, then executing the test machine upgrade as the production system's Dress Rehearsal Migration.
    This method complicates the project's test plan and is therefore impractical.
  2. Add a system to the landscape in some manner and perform a Dress Rehearsal Migration on the production machine.
    This method does not clearly define how to add a system to the landscape or the constraints on what operations can be performed on the system.
    For example, I have the following questions.
    ・Is it possible to retry the rehearsal?
    ・Can the added system integrate with customer-specific external systems?
    However, I believe this method is likely the most realistic approach for a Dress Rehearsalin RISE.

For this topic, I would appreciate answers regarding methods for a Dress Rehearsal Migration that comply with SAP's regulations.
Sharing information about approaches used for actual customer Dress Rehearsal Migrations is also acceptable.

Following SAP's Clean Core policy, the necessity for a Dress Rehearsal Migration is thought to be low.
However, customers are migrating to RISE while retaining add-ons from the ECC era, making eliminating the Dress Rehearsal unrealistic.
When proposing the optimal Dress Rehearsal Migration approach for this customer, what methods are available?

entry.title: CAP at SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Dear SAP community,

SAP TechEd 2025 is almost there! This year, SAP TechEd is a hybrid event: from November 4 – 6 you can either join the in-person event in Berlin or the online event SAP TechEd Virtual. Hundreds of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities are waiting for you.

If you didn’t already do it, save the date and register today: SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual!

In the session catalogs for the in-person and the virtual event, you will find a wide range of topics across various tracks. If you are interested in all the latest news around the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), let me guide you through my recommendations.

Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next

Some experts argue there’s a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let’s get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever. Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt these changing roles.

This session is also available virtually: KEY100v.

Strategy Talk

ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools

Explore the most recent innovations in SAP Build solutions that help developers to create extensions, applications, and automations. Learn how enhancements in the development environment, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, and Joule copilot empower customers and partners to build extensions efficiently at scale.

This session is also available virtually: ST116v.

Roadmap Sessions

AD820 | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying Clean Core & LoB extensions​

Check out upcoming enhancements to SAP Build solutions involving SAP’s professional developer tools, the Joule copliot, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, SAPUI5, and SAP Fiori apps. These updates boost developer productivity, support clean core, and improve extensibility for line-of-business (LoB) apps, advancing enterprise app development.

This session is also available virtually: AD820v.

Deep Dive Sessions

AD101 | Integration of SAP Business Data Cloud with CAP and SAP Build​

The SAP Business Data Cloud solution unifies SAP and third-party data, and SAP Build solutions let you discover and use data products in the service center and consume them in apps based on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Get details on sharing data from these apps and using built-in tools for service-level integration.

AD203 | Fact checking UI Extensibility on top of CAP/RAP: What's in it for you?​

SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps in a clean core approach. Key users use drag-and-drop tools while developers add custom code with visual editors and the Joule copilot. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and ABAP RESTful application programming model help extend data models and add custom logic in SAP Build solutions.

Hands-On Workshops:

AD160 | Get Hands-On with Joule: Boost Your SAP Build Development with AI​

The SAP Joule for Developers add-on brings AI capabilities directly into SAP Build solutions to support your development process. Get hands-on experience using AI-driven tools to boost your productivity in SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and UI development, with features designed to simplify your workflow and help you build faster and smarter.                                                                            

AD161 | Integration of SAP Business Data Cloud with CAP and SAP Build​

Get hands-on experience with the SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Build solutions to find out how to discover and use data products in apps based on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Practice sharing data from CAP apps and using built-in tools for service integration and SAP HANA–based data federation.

AD260 | UI Extensibility on top of CAP/RAP: What's in it for you?​

SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps with a clean core approach. Key users and developers can add custom code with visual editors and Joule technology. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and the ABAP RESTful application programming model support extending data models and adding custom logic in the SAP Build solution.

DT265 | Provision and extend multitenant solutions based on CAP for SAP Cloud ERP​

Experience how to provision, configure, and extend multitenant solutions based on SAP Business Technology Platform and the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) for SAP Cloud ERP. Using a reference example, you’ll explore how to deliver customer-specific extensions on a scalable and resource-efficient multitenant architecture.

 

We can’t wait to see you at SAP TechEd 2025, either in Berlin or virtually!

entry.title: Test Double to simulate ABAP "Datasets", WRITE, MESSAGE, sy-uzeit, etc.
entry.content:
• Example how to use ZCL_ABAP
  • List of supported ABAP keywords
  • List of supported system variables

When writing ABAP Unit, it may be needed to mock ABAP keywords like OPEN DATASET, TRANSFER, MESSAGE, WRITE or system variables like SY-UZEIT, SY-UNAME.

As far as I know, still in the latest ABAP version 7.58, there are no test doubles proposed for them.

I published the code in GitHub with MIT License: sandraros/abapDouble: Wrapper and test doubler of ABAP Language elements OPEN DATASET, WRITE...

The main class is ZCL_ABAP.

It handles few ABAP statements and doesn't handle the many possibilities of each proposed ABAP statement but you may easily adapt it.

This article is (of course) for private Cloud and on-premises ABAP systems.

Example how to use ZCL_ABAP

If you had this code:

DATA(file_path) = '/tmp/test'.
OPEN DATASET file_path FOR OUTPUT IN TEXT MODE ENCODING UTF-8.
DATA(text) = |Hello world, now is { sy-uzeit TIME = USER }|.
TRANSFER text TO file_path.
CLOSE DATASET file_path.

Convert it to this code:

DATA(abap) = zcl_abap=>get_singleton( ).
DATA(file_path) = '/tmp/test'.
abap->open_dataset( iv_file_path = file_path
                    iv_for       = abap->cs_open_dataset-for-output
                    iv_in_mode   = abap->cs_open_dataset-in_mode-text
                    iv_encoding  = abap->cs_open_dataset-encoding-utf_8 ).
abap->transfer( iv_data      = |Hello world, now is { abap->get_sy_uzeit( ) TIME = USER }|
                iv_file_path = file_path ).
abap->close_dataset( iv_file_path = file_path ).

Test it this way:

METHOD first_test. " declared FOR TESTING
  " GIVEN now is 152800 (fake)
  DATA(abap) = ztd_abap=>get_singleton( ).
  abap->set_sy_uzeit( '152800' ).

  " WHEN code under test is called
  call_cut( ).

  " THEN the file contains this data with fake 152800
  cl_abap_unit_assert=>assert_equals( act = abap->get_dataset( '/tmp/test' )-content
                                      exp = VALUE string_table( ( |Hello world, now is 15:28:00| ) ) ).
ENDMETHOD.

 

List of supported ABAP keywords

As of October 30th (the repository may evolve in GitHub in the future):

  • CLOSE DATASET
  • DELETE DATASET
  • MESSAGE
    • Limited to text, message type, display like. It also gives the possibility to re-send the current system message (variables SY-MSGNO, etc.)
  • OPEN DATASET
    • Limited to text mode, encodings default and UTF-8
  • TRANSFER
  • WRITE
    • Limited to character-like text and to these options /: (write on a new line), not / (write on the current line), colors, position in the current line.
  • WRITE TO
    • Limited to character-like text.

List of supported system variables

As of October 30th (the repository may evolve in GitHub in the future):

  • SY-DATUM
    • Use ZCL_ABAP=>GET_SINGLETON( )->GET_SY_DATUM( )
  • SY-LINSZ
  • SY-REPID
  • SY-SLSET
  • SY-TITLE
  • SY-UNAME
  • SY-UZEIT

Sandra

entry.title: Re: BAPI_ROUTING_CREATE
entry.content:
Report ZTEST2.

TYPE-POOLS : slis.

 

TYPES : BEGIN OF ty_routing,
material LIKE bapi1012_mtk_c-material,
plant LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-plant,
tsk_desc LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-description,
task_list_usage LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-task_list_usage,
task_list_status LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-task_list_status,
ident_key LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-ident_key,
"Identification for the Inspection Point Field Combination
* lot_size_from LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-lot_size_from,
* lot_size_to LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-lot_size_to,
* task_measure_unit LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-task_measure_unit,
op_activity LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-activity,
* planning_work_center LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-planning_work_center,
control_key LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-control_key,
work_cntr LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-work_cntr,
op_description LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-description,
* operation_measure_unit LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-operation_measure_unit,
BASE_QUANTITY LIKE BAPI1012_OPR_C-BASE_QUANTITY, "added
std_value_01 LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-std_value_01,
std_value_02 LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-std_value_02,
std_value_03 LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-std_value_03,
std_value_04 LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-std_value_04,
std_value_05 LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-std_value_05,
std_value_06 LIKE bapi1012_opr_c-std_value_06,
* ins_activity LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-activity,
* inspchar LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-inspchar,
* quantitative_ind LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-quantitative_ind,
mstr_char LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-mstr_char,
quantitative_ind LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-quantitative_ind,
* cha_master_import_modus LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-cha_master_import_modus,
* char_descr LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-char_descr,
method LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-method,
smpl_procedure LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-smpl_procedure,
* smpl_unit LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-smpl_unit,
* smpl_quant LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-smpl_quant,
* formula_ind LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-formula_ind,
* lsl_ind LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-lw_tol_lmt_ind,
* usl_ind LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-up_tol_lmt_ind,
* tgt_ind LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-target_val_check_ind,
summ_rec(1) TYPE c,
sing_rec(1) TYPE c,
target_val LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-target_val,
lw_tol_lmt LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-lw_tol_lmt,
up_tol_lmt LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-up_tol_lmt,
formula1 LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-formula_field_1,
formula2 LIKE bapi1012_cha_c-formula_field_1,
END OF ty_routing.

**********************************************************************
* Constants Declarations
**********************************************************************

**********************************************************************
* Global variables
**********************************************************************
DATA : v_exit TYPE c.
DATA: gv_test_run TYPE bapiflag,
gv_group TYPE bapi1012_tsk_c-task_list_group,
gv_gr_counter TYPE bapi1012_tsk_c-group_counter,
gv_file TYPE localfile,
gv_row TYPE n,
gv_plant LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-plant,
gv_lines TYPE i,
gv_per TYPE p,
gv_txt(50) TYPE c.

**********************************************************************
* Internal Table Declarations
**********************************************************************
* Data Declarations for import internal table parameters to BAPI

DATA : it_task TYPE TABLE OF bapi1012_tsk_c WITH HEADER LINE,
it_mat_task_allo TYPE TABLE OF bapi1012_mtk_c WITH HEADER LINE,
it_inspchar TYPE TABLE OF bapi1012_cha_c WITH HEADER LINE,
it_op TYPE TABLE OF bapi1012_opr_c WITH HEADER LINE,
it_ret TYPE TABLE OF bapiret2 WITH HEADER LINE.

* Declare Internal table for Message Header for ALV Display

DATA: BEGIN OF it_loghead OCCURS 0,
material LIKE bapi1012_mtk_c-material,
plant LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-plant,
msgtype LIKE bapiret2-type,
msg(100) TYPE c,
expand TYPE c,
END OF it_loghead .

* Declare Internal table for Message Details for ALV Display

DATA: BEGIN OF it_logdetail OCCURS 0,
material LIKE bapi1012_mtk_c-material,
plant LIKE bapi1012_tsk_c-plant,
msgtype LIKE bapiret2-type,
msg(100) TYPE c,
END OF it_logdetail.

* Internal Table to Load and Hold Data from the Text File

DATA : it_routing TYPE TABLE OF ty_routing WITH HEADER LINE.


**********************************************************************
* Work Area Declarations
**********************************************************************
DATA : wa_routing TYPE ty_routing.

**********************************************************************
* Selection Screen
**********************************************************************

*SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE text-001.
*PARAMETERS :
*SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b1.

**********************************************************************
* At Selection Screen
**********************************************************************

**********************************************************************
* Start-of-selection
**********************************************************************

START-OF-SELECTION.
* Clear Internal Tables holding Messages

CLEAR it_loghead[].
CLEAR it_logdetail[].

* Call Subroutine to Show File Dialog
PERFORM choose_data_file.

* Call Subroutine to Load data into Internal table from text file
PERFORM load_data_from_file.

* Determine the number of records in the internal table
DESCRIBE TABLE it_routing LINES gv_lines.
IF gv_lines <> 0.
PERFORM populate_bapi_tables.
ENDIF.

IF it_task IS NOT INITIAL.
* Call Subroutine to upload last routing details
PERFORM call_bapi_and_commit.
ENDIF.

* Call Subroutine to Display Log in ALV
PERFORM display_log_list.

**********************************************************************
* End-of-selection
**********************************************************************
END-OF-SELECTION.

**********************************************************************
* Forms and subroutines
**********************************************************************

*&--------------------------------------------------------------------

*& Form CHOOSE_DATA_FILE

*&--------------------------------------------------------------------

* Subroutine to Show File Dialog and select file from the PC

*---------------------------------------------------------------------

FORM choose_data_file .

 

DATA: lt_filetable TYPE filetable,
lf_rc TYPE i,
lv_fname(50) TYPE c,
lv_fext(3) TYPE c.
DATA: lw_file TYPE file_table.

 

* Function module to show File open Dialog

CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog
EXPORTING
window_title = 'Select Routing Data File'
file_filter = '*.txt'
multiselection = abap_false
CHANGING
file_table = lt_filetable
rc = lf_rc
EXCEPTIONS
file_open_dialog_failed = 1
cntl_error = 2
error_no_gui = 3
not_supported_by_gui = 4
OTHERS = 5.

IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE 'S' NUMBER sy-msgno
DISPLAY LIKE 'E'
WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
EXIT.
ENDIF.

* Number of selected filed must be equal to one.

CHECK lf_rc = 1.

* Access selected file

 


READ TABLE lt_filetable INTO lw_file INDEX 1.
CHECK sy-subrc = 0.
gv_file = lw_file-filename.
SPLIT gv_file AT '.' INTO lv_fname lv_fext.

* Check if Text file is Selected
* IF lv_fext NE 'txt'.
* MESSAGE 'Invalid File Type !' TYPE 'I'.
** SUBMIT z_bapi_qp01.
* ENDIF.

ENDFORM. " CHOOSE_DATA_FILE

 

*&--------------------------------------------------------------------

*& Form LOAD_DATA_FROM_FILE

*&--------------------------------------------------------------------

* Subroutine to Load data into Internal table from text file

*---------------------------------------------------------------------

FORM load_data_from_file .
DATA: lv_file_name TYPE string.

lv_file_name = gv_file.
* Call Function module to load data from Text File
CALL FUNCTION 'GUI_UPLOAD'
EXPORTING
filename = lv_file_name
filetype = 'ASC'
has_field_separator = 'X'
TABLES
data_tab = it_routing
EXCEPTIONS "#EC *
file_open_error = 1
file_read_error = 2
no_batch = 3
gui_refuse_filetransfer = 4
invalid_type = 5
no_authority = 6
unknown_error = 7
bad_data_format = 8
header_not_allowed = 9
separator_not_allowed = 10
header_too_long = 11
unknown_dp_error = 12
access_denied = 13
dp_out_of_memory = 14
disk_full = 15
dp_timeout = 16
OTHERS = 17.
IF sy-subrc <> 0. "#EC NEEDED
MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
ENDIF.

LOOP AT it_routing WHERE material IS NOT INITIAL.
CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT'
EXPORTING
input = it_routing-material
IMPORTING
output = it_routing-material.
MODIFY it_routing TRANSPORTING material.
ENDLOOP.
ENDFORM. " LOAD_DATA_FROM_FILE

 


*&--------------------------------------------------------------------

*& Form CLEAR_INTERNAL_TABLES

*&--------------------------------------------------------------------

* Subroutine to Clear Internal Tables

*---------------------------------------------------------------------

FORM clear_internal_tables .

CLEAR it_mat_task_allo[].

CLEAR it_task[].

CLEAR it_op[].

CLEAR it_inspchar[].

CLEAR it_ret[].

ENDFORM. " CLEAR_INTERNAL_TABLES


*&--------------------------------------------------------------------
*& Form POPULATE_BAPI_TABLES
*&--------------------------------------------------------------------
FORM populate_bapi_tables .
DATA : lv_act(4) TYPE n,
lv_opr(4) TYPE n.
* Loop at internal table to load all data

LOOP AT it_routing.
* Call Subroutine to Display the Progress
PERFORM display_progress_timer.
ON CHANGE OF it_routing-material.
* IF it_routing-ins_activity IS INITIAL AND it_task IS NOT INITIAL.
IF it_routing-material IS NOT INITIAL AND it_task IS NOT INITIAL.
* Call Subroutine to Load the routing
PERFORM call_bapi_and_commit.

* Re-initialise the internal tables
PERFORM clear_internal_tables.
ENDIF.

IF it_routing-plant IS NOT INITIAL.
gv_plant = it_routing-plant.
ENDIF.

ENDON.

IF it_routing-op_activity IS NOT INITIAL.
lv_opr = it_routing-op_activity.
CLEAR lv_act.
ENDIF.

IF it_routing-plant NE space.
CLEAR : lv_act,
it_mat_task_allo.
* Moving Corresponding fields to Material internal table
it_mat_task_allo-material = it_routing-material.
it_mat_task_allo-plant = gv_plant.
it_mat_task_allo-valid_from = sy-datum.
APPEND IT_MAT_TASK_ALLO.
CLEAR IT_MAT_TASK_ALLO.

* Moving Corresponding fields to task internal table
CLEAR it_task.
it_task-valid_from = sy-datum.
it_task-description = it_routing-tsk_desc.
it_task-task_list_usage = it_routing-task_list_usage.
it_task-task_list_status = it_routing-task_list_status.
it_task-lot_size_from = '1'.
* it_task-lot_size_to = it_routing-lot_size_to.
it_task-lot_size_to = '999999'.
* it_task-planning_work_center = it_routing-planning_work_center.
it_task-plant = gv_plant.
* it_task-task_measure_unit = it_routing-task_measure_unit.
SELECT SINGLE meins FROM mara INTO it_task-task_measure_unit
WHERE matnr = it_routing-material.
it_task-ident_key = it_routing-ident_key.
APPEND it_task.

* Moving Corresponding fields to Operation internal table
CLEAR it_op.
it_op-valid_from = sy-datum.
it_op-activity = lv_opr.
it_op-plant = gv_plant.
it_op-control_key = it_routing-control_key.
it_op-work_cntr = it_routing-work_cntr.
it_op-description = it_routing-op_description.
* it_op-operation_measure_unit = it_routing-operation_measure_unit.
it_op-operation_measure_unit = it_task-task_measure_unit.
it_op-denominator = '1'.
it_op-nominator = '1'.
* it_op-base_quantity = '1.000'.
IT_OP-BASE_QUANTITY = IT_ROUTING-BASE_QUANTITY. " added
* it_op-insp_point_complt_flow_variant = '3'.
it_op-free_grid ='X'.
it_op-std_value_01 = it_routing-std_value_01.
it_op-std_value_02 = it_routing-std_value_02.
it_op-std_value_03 = it_routing-std_value_03.
it_op-std_value_04 = it_routing-std_value_04.
it_op-std_value_05 = it_routing-std_value_05.
it_op-std_value_06 = it_routing-std_value_06.
APPEND it_op.
ELSE.
IF it_routing-op_activity IS NOT INITIAL.
* Moving Corresponding fields to Operation internal table
CLEAR it_op.
it_op-valid_from = sy-datum.
it_op-activity = lv_opr.
it_op-plant = gv_plant.
it_op-control_key = it_routing-control_key.
it_op-work_cntr = it_routing-work_cntr.
it_op-description = it_routing-op_description.
* it_op-operation_measure_unit = it_routing-operation_measure_unit.
it_op-operation_measure_unit = it_task-task_measure_unit.
it_op-denominator = '1'.
it_op-nominator = '1'.
* it_op-base_quantity = '1.000'.
it_op-base_quantity = IT_ROUTING-BASE_QUANTITY. " added
it_op-insp_point_complt_flow_variant = '3'.
it_op-std_value_01 = it_routing-std_value_01.
it_op-std_value_02 = it_routing-std_value_02.
it_op-std_value_03 = it_routing-std_value_03.
it_op-std_value_04 = it_routing-std_value_04.
it_op-std_value_05 = it_routing-std_value_05.
it_op-std_value_06 = it_routing-std_value_06.
APPEND it_op.
ELSE.

lv_act = lv_act + 10.
*Moving Corresponding fields to Inspection Characteris internal table
CLEAR it_inspchar.
it_inspchar-activity = it_routing-op_activity.
it_inspchar-activity = lv_opr.
it_inspchar-inspchar = lv_act.
it_inspchar-valid_from = sy-datum.
it_inspchar-mstr_char = it_routing-mstr_char.
it_inspchar-pmstr_char = gv_plant.
it_inspchar-method = it_routing-method.
it_inspchar-pmethod = gv_plant.
* Measured Values Must Be Recorded
it_inspchar-meas_value_confirm_ind = 'X'.
IF it_routing-smpl_procedure IS NOT INITIAL.
it_inspchar-sampling_procedure_ind = 'X'.
it_inspchar-smpl_procedure = it_routing-smpl_procedure.
it_inspchar-smpl_unit = it_task-task_measure_unit.
it_inspchar-smpl_quant = 1. "it_routing-smpl_quant.
ENDIF.
* it_inspchar-dec_places = 2.
it_inspchar-cha_master_import_modus = 'N'.
* Get Characteristic Description and decimal places
SELECT SINGLE sortfeld stellen FROM qpmk
INTO (it_inspchar-char_descr, it_inspchar-dec_places)
WHERE zaehler = gv_plant
AND mkmnr = it_routing-mstr_char.
it_inspchar-quantitative_ind = it_routing-quantitative_ind.
IF it_routing-quantitative_ind IS INITIAL.
it_inspchar-attribute_required_ind = 'X'.
SELECT SINGLE auswmenge1 FROM qpmz
INTO it_inspchar-sel_set1
WHERE zaehler = gv_plant
AND mkmnr = it_routing-mstr_char.
it_inspchar-psel_set1 = gv_plant.
ENDIF.
IF it_routing-target_val IS NOT INITIAL.
it_inspchar-target_val_check_ind = 'X'.
it_inspchar-meas_value_confirm_ind = 'X'.
ENDIF.
IF it_routing-up_tol_lmt IS NOT INITIAL.
it_inspchar-up_tol_lmt_ind = 'X'.
it_inspchar-meas_value_confirm_ind = 'X'.
ENDIF.
IF it_routing-lw_tol_lmt IS NOT INITIAL.
it_inspchar-lw_tol_lmt_ind = 'X'.
it_inspchar-meas_value_confirm_ind = 'X'.
ENDIF.
IF ( it_routing-formula1 IS NOT INITIAL OR
it_routing-formula2 IS NOT INITIAL ).
it_inspchar-formula_ind = 'X'.
it_inspchar-meas_value_confirm_ind = 'X'.
it_inspchar-formula_check_by_sap = 'X'.
ENDIF.
IF it_routing-summ_rec = 'X'.
it_inspchar-result_recording_type = ' '.
ELSE.
it_inspchar-result_recording_type = '+'.
ENDIF.
it_inspchar-target_val = it_routing-target_val.
it_inspchar-up_tol_lmt = it_routing-up_tol_lmt.
it_inspchar-lw_tol_lmt = it_routing-lw_tol_lmt.
it_inspchar-formula_field_1 = it_routing-formula1.
it_inspchar-formula_field_2 = it_routing-formula2.
it_inspchar-meas_unit = '%'.
APPEND it_inspchar.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

ENDLOOP.

ENDFORM. " POPULATE_BAPI_TABLES

*&--------------------------------------------------------------------
*& Form Display_Progress_timer
*&--------------------------------------------------------------------
* Subroutine to show Progress at Status Bar
*---------------------------------------------------------------------

FORM display_progress_timer .
gv_per = sy-tabix / gv_lines * 100.
WRITE gv_per TO gv_txt.
CONDENSE gv_txt.
CONCATENATE gv_txt '% of Routings Completed...'
INTO gv_txt SEPARATED BY space.

CALL FUNCTION 'SAPGUI_PROGRESS_INDICATOR'
EXPORTING
percentage = gv_per
text = gv_txt.

ENDFORM. " Display_Progress_timer

*&--------------------------------------------------------------------
*& Form CALL_BAPI_AND_COMMIT
*&--------------------------------------------------------------------
* Subroutine to Load the Routings
*---------------------------------------------------------------------

FORM call_bapi_and_commit .

* Initialise internal table

REFRESH it_ret.

* Call Function to Create Routing
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ROUTING_CREATE'
* EXPORTING
* TESTRUN = ' '
* PROFILE =
* BOMUSAGE =
* APPLICATION =
IMPORTING
group = gv_group
groupcounter = gv_gr_counter
TABLES
task = it_task
materialtaskallocation = it_mat_task_allo
* SEQUENCE =
operation = it_op
* SUBOPERATION =
* REFERENCEOPERATION =
* WORKCENTERREFERENCE =
* COMPONENTALLOCATION =
* PRODUCTIONRESOURCE =
inspcharacteristic = it_inspchar
* TEXTALLOCATION =
* TEXT =
return = it_ret
.

READ TABLE it_ret INDEX 1.
DESCRIBE TABLE it_ret.

* Check for success message and then Commit, otherwise dont commit
IF it_ret-type EQ 'S' AND sy-tfill EQ 1.
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
EXPORTING
WAIT = 'X'
* IMPORTING
* RETURN =
.

* Populate Success message in internal table for ALV Log display
it_loghead-plant = gv_plant.
it_loghead-material = it_mat_task_allo-material.
it_loghead-msgtype = 'S'.
CONCATENATE 'Routing Created Successfully' gv_group
INTO it_loghead-msg SEPARATED BY space.
APPEND it_loghead.

ELSE.
* Populate Error message in internal table for ALV Log display
it_loghead-plant = gv_plant.
it_loghead-material = it_mat_task_allo-material.
it_loghead-msgtype = 'E'.
it_loghead-msg = 'Routing Not Created'.
APPEND it_loghead.
* Retrieve and populate Error Details for Log Display
CLEAR it_ret.
LOOP AT it_ret.
it_logdetail-plant = gv_plant.
it_logdetail-material = it_mat_task_allo-material.
it_logdetail-msgtype = it_ret-type.
it_logdetail-msg = it_ret-message.
IF it_ret-parameter IS NOT INITIAL.
CONCATENATE it_logdetail-msg '- Error in parameter'
it_ret-parameter INTO it_logdetail-msg SEPARATED BY space.
IF it_ret-row IS NOT INITIAL.
gv_row = it_ret-row.
CONCATENATE it_logdetail-msg '- In Row' gv_row
INTO it_logdetail-msg SEPARATED BY space.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.
APPEND it_logdetail.
ENDLOOP.

REFRESH it_ret.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM. " CALL_BAPI_AND_COMMIT

*&--------------------------------------------------------------------
*& Form DISPLAY_LOG_LIST
*&--------------------------------------------------------------------
* Subroutine to Display Log
*---------------------------------------------------------------------

FORM display_log_list .
DATA: it_fieldcat TYPE slis_t_fieldcat_alv,
wa_fieldcat TYPE LINE OF slis_t_fieldcat_alv,
wa_layout TYPE slis_layout_alv,
it_keyinfo TYPE TABLE OF slis_keyinfo_alv WITH HEADER LINE.
DATA lv_repid LIKE sy-repid.

* Store report name
lv_repid = sy-repid.
* Create FieldCatalog for ALV
CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_FIELDCATALOG_MERGE'
EXPORTING
i_program_name = lv_repid
i_internal_tabname = 'IT_LOGHEAD'
i_inclname = lv_repid
CHANGING
ct_fieldcat = it_fieldcat
EXCEPTIONS
inconsistent_interface = 1
program_error = 2
OTHERS = 3.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
ENDIF.

CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_FIELDCATALOG_MERGE'
EXPORTING
i_program_name = lv_repid
i_internal_tabname = 'IT_LOGDETAIL'
i_inclname = lv_repid
CHANGING
ct_fieldcat = it_fieldcat
EXCEPTIONS
inconsistent_interface = 1
program_error = 2
OTHERS = 3.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
ENDIF.

LOOP AT it_fieldcat INTO wa_fieldcat WHERE fieldname = 'MSG'.
wa_fieldcat-seltext_l = 'Message'.
wa_fieldcat-seltext_m = 'Message'.
wa_fieldcat-seltext_s = 'Message'.
MODIFY it_fieldcat FROM wa_fieldcat.
ENDLOOP.

it_keyinfo-header01 = 'PLANT'.
it_keyinfo-header02 = 'MATERIAL'.
it_keyinfo-item01 = 'PLANT'.
it_keyinfo-item02 = 'MATERIAL'.
APPEND it_keyinfo.

wa_layout-expand_fieldname = 'EXPAND'.
wa_layout-def_status = ' '.
SORT it_logdetail BY plant material msg.
DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM it_logdetail COMPARING
plant material msg.

* Call function to display ALV LOG
CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_HIERSEQ_LIST_DISPLAY'
EXPORTING
i_callback_program = sy-repid
it_fieldcat = it_fieldcat
is_layout = wa_layout
i_default = 'X'
i_save = 'A'
i_tabname_header = 'IT_LOGHEAD'
i_tabname_item = 'IT_LOGDETAIL'
is_keyinfo = it_keyinfo
i_bypassing_buffer = 'X'
i_suppress_empty_data = abap_true
TABLES
t_outtab_header = it_loghead
t_outtab_item = it_logdetail
EXCEPTIONS
program_error = 1
OTHERS = 2.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
ENDIF.

ENDFORM. " DISPLAY_LOG_LIST

entry.title: Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoice Approval in S/4HANA
entry.content:
📘Comprehensive Guide: Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoice Approval in S/4HANA

Welcome to your practical guide for understanding, configuring, and testing the flexible workflow for supplier invoices in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This document is designed for all users—from End Users ("Dummies") who need to understand the process, to Key Users and Consultants responsible for building and configuring the system.

We will transform the technical activation steps from your document into a full, end-to-end business process, complete with concepts, configuration, and a real-world test plan.

  1. 💡Concepts: What is Flexible Workflow? (For End Users)

Before we configure anything, let's understand the "what" and "why."

What is it?

The Flexible Workflow is the modern SAP S/4HANA method for managing approval processes. Think of it as a smart, digital approval form. Instead of emailing your manager a PDF to sign, the system does it for you.

When a supplier invoice is created, the system checks a set of rules (e.g., "Is the amount over $1,000?" or "Is it for a specific cost center?"). If a rule is met, the workflow automatically sends an approval task to the correct person.

Why use it?

It replaces old, rigid approval processes. The "flexible" part means that Key Users can easily change the approval rules (like the approver or the amount) directly in a Fiori app, without needing a developer.

The End-to-End Process:

  1. Enter Invoice: An Accounts Payable (AP) Accountant posts a supplier invoice.
  2. Trigger Workflow: The system sees the invoice amount is over $1,000 and automatically blocks it for payment. It sends an approval task to the designated Purchasing Manager.
  3. Approve from Inbox: The Purchasing Manager logs in and sees a new item in their My Inbox app. They review the invoice details and click "Approve."
  4. Release Invoice: The system automatically removes the payment block. The invoice is now ready to be paid in the next payment run.
  1. 🛠️ Configuration Guide (For Key Users & Consultants)

This section details the "how-to" build the process. It's broken into two parts: activating the feature (from your document) and defining the rules.

Part A: How to Activate Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices

This is the foundational step that turns the feature on for your S/4HANA Cloud system. This is done in the Manage Your Solution or Central Business Configuration (CBC) environment1.

Prerequisite: You must be logged in with the Configuration Expert - Business Process Configuration role2.

Step-by-Step Procedure:

  1. Navigate to Configuration:
    • Log on to the SAP Fiori Launchpad3.
    • Open the Manage Your Solution (F1241) app4.
    • Click Configure Your Solution5.
  2. Find the Configuration Step:
    • In the search bar, type Activate Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoice6.
    • The system will find the configuration item. Click on it.
    • On the right-hand side, click Configure to proceed7.
  3. Set Activation Parameters:
    • The system displays the Change View "Activate Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices": Detail screen8.
    • To enable the workflow for invoices, you must select the following checkboxes:
      • Payment Block: Flexible Workflow is Active 9
      • Release Completed Invoice: Flexible Workflow is Active 10
    • (Optional) You can also select Check Authorizations for Flexible Workflow Steps if you need an extra authorization check during the approval process11.
  4. Save Your Changes:
    • Click the Save button12.
    • The system will prompt you for a customizing request. Assign it to your transport request to save the configuration13.

Result: You have now activated the scenario-based workflow for supplier invoices14. The system is ready to use the workflow, but first, we must tell it who approves what.

Part B: How to Define the Workflow Rules

Activation is the "on switch." Now we define the rules in the Manage Workflows app.

Prerequisite: You need the Business Process Specialist role.

  1. Open the App: From the Fiori Launchpad, open the Manage Workflows app.
  2. Select the Scenario: The app asks what process you want to manage. Select "Workflow for Blocked Invoice" (as seen in your document's final screenshot 15) or "Workflow for Parked Invoice," depending on your business process.
  3. Create New Workflow:
    • Click the Create button.
    • Name: Give it a clear name, for example, "Invoice Approval > 1000 EUR".
    • Validity: Set the start and end dates.
  4. Define Preconditions (The "When"):
    • This is the trigger. Under the "Start Conditions" section, define when this workflow should activate.
    • Example:
      • Click Add.
      • Select Total gross amount in company code currency is greater than 1,000 EUR.
    • You can add more conditions, such as "Company Code is 1000" or "Invoice is Manually Blocked."
  5. Define Steps (The "Who"):
    • This is the approval chain.
    • Click Add in the "Step Sequence" section.
    • Name: "Manager Approval."
    • Type: "Release of Blocked Invoice."
    • Recipients: This is who gets the task in their My Inbox.
      • Assignment By: Role
      • Role: Manager (This will send it to the manager of the person who created the invoice).
      • Alternatively, you can assign it to a specific person (User) or team.
    • Exception Handling (Optional): Define what happens if the approver rejects the invoice (e.g., "Send back to AP Accountant for Rework").
  6. Activate the Workflow:
    • Click Save.
    • Click Activate.

Result: You now have a live workflow. Any supplier invoice over 1,000 EUR will be blocked and sent to the creator's manager for approval.

  1. 🧪 End-to-End Business Case & Test Plan

Now let's test our complete setup with a real-world business case.

Business Case: Approving a High-Value Supplier Invoice

  • Objective: Test the newly activated workflow. An AP Accountant will enter an invoice for $5,000 (which is > $1,000). This must be approved by a Purchasing Manager before it can be paid.
  • Roles for Test:
    • User 1: Accounts Payable Accountant
    • User 2: Purchasing Manager (The Approver)
  • Master Data for Test:
    • Purchase Order: We will use a PO from our previous procurement guides (e.g., PO 4500080029).
    • Vendor: 3678 (VALOIS SAS)
    • Invoice Amount: $5,000 (Any value that meets your workflow precondition)
  • Workflow Prerequisite: The workflow we defined in Part 2B is active with a precondition of "Amount > 1,000" and the approver assigned to the Manager role.

Test Procedure: Step-by-Step

Test Step #

Role

Test Step Name

Instruction

Expected Result

Pass / Fail

1

AP Accountant

Post Blocked Invoice

1. Log on to the Fiori Launchpad.

 

2. Open the Create Supplier Invoice (F0859) app (or GUI MIRO).

 

3. Enter the PO Number (e.g., 4500080029), Invoice Date, and Reference.

 

4. Enter the Amount: 5000.00.

 

5. Click Post.

The invoice is posted but is automatically Blocked for Payment.

 

A message indicates that the invoice has been submitted for approval.

 

2

Purchasing Manager

Receive Approval Task

1. Log on to the Fiori Launchpad as the manager.

 

2. Open the My Inbox (F086) app.

A new task, "Release Invoice for Payment," appears in the inbox.

 

The task details show Vendor 3678 and Amount $5,000.

 

3

Purchasing Manager

Approve Invoice

1. Open the task from the inbox.

 

2. Review the invoice details (PO, amount, vendor).

 

3. Click the Approve button.

The task disappears from the inbox.

 

The system logs the approval.

 

4

AP Accountant

Verify Invoice Release

1. Log on as the AP Accountant.

 

2. Open the Manage Supplier Invoices (F1060A) app (or GUI MIR4).

 

3. Find the invoice posted in Step 1.

 

4. Check the "Status" or "Payment Block" field.

The invoice status is no longer "Blocked for Payment."

 

The payment block has been removed. The invoice is now ready for the payment run.

 

5

AP Accountant

(Follow-on) Payment

1. (Simulate) Run the Manage Automatic Payments (F0770) app.

The invoice (from Step 1) is now included in the payment proposal, as it is unblocked and due.

 
  1. Conclusion

You have successfully completed the end-to-end process for activating and using the Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices.

By following this guide, you have:

  1. Understood the business value of the Flexible Workflow.
  2. Configured the S/4HANA Cloud system to activate the feature using the Manage Your Solution app 16.
  3. Defined custom approval rules using the Manage Workflows app.
  4. Executed a realistic test plan, proving that the workflow correctly triggers, sends an item to the My Inbox, and releases the invoice for payment upon approval.

 

Activate Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoice in @SAP CLOUD

Context

In this procedure, you activate flexible workflow for supplier invoice.

If you want to use the flexible workflow to approve the supplier invoice, you have to process the step: Activate Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoice.

Procedure

Depending on your configuration environment for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, choose one of the following options:

 

Configure Your Solution:

 

 

Log on to the SAP Fiori launchpad as a Configuration Expert - Business Process Configuration.

 

The SAP Fiori Launchpad displays.

 

 

Open Manage Your Solution (F1241) .          

 

 

The Manage Your Solution screen displays.

 

Choose Configure Your Solution.    

 

The Configure Your Solution screen displays.

 

Search Activate Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoice, choose configuration with name Incoming Invoice from search result, then choose Configure on the right of configuration steps with name Activate Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices.       

 

 

 

The Change View "Activate Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices": Detail screen displays.

 

Select checkbox Payment Block: Flexible Workflow is Active,

Select checkbox Release Completed Invoice: Flexible Workflow is Active

Select checkbox Check Authorizations for Flexible Workflow Steps (Optional)

 

 

Choose Save.

 

Note You may be asked to enter a customizing request number, either choose your own customizing request or create a new one, then choose Continue. 

 

 

Result

The Scenario based workflow is activated for Supplier Invoices.

entry.title: Re: Fixed Asset Migration with Asset Sub number errors
entry.content:
Hi,

 

On our HelpPortal you can find a section for Asset subnumbers.

Asset Subnumbers

When you want to transfer asset subnumbers, you need to consider the following:

  • Main asset numbers and their corresponding subnumbers need to be migrated in the same migration project. This ensures that the system automatically maps the main legacy asset and the asset numbers. (This is due to the project-specific mapping table of the main asset number.)

  • Before you migrate asset subnumbers, ensure that you migrate all corresponding main assets. Please make sure that the main assets are not only uploaded to the staging tables but completely and successfully migrated

Hello Everyone.

At the time of creation a sales order in REAL ESTATE SECTOR in SAP S/4 HANA PUBLIC CLOUD, the GST TAX Code in Pricing condition is taking wrong code.

As per Indian GST Act, in case of Real Estate Sector, Place of supply will be determine based on the location where the immovable property is located, irrespective of the location of supplier or recipient.

2.  Property location in Uttar Pradesh

At the time of creation of sales order, IGST is automatically triggered as Plant Location & Customer Region is different as per SAP GST Configuration IN SAP S/4 HANA PUBLIC CLOUD, while the CGST & SGST should be taken.

Now to cater this, we have created a dummy SHIP TO PARTY Business Partner based on the property location i.e. UP, in order to get the CGST & SGST Tax code in pricing condition while maintaining same under Partner Function TAB of the customer located in WEST BENGAL, but still IGST appears.

Can anyone help on this issue...

Regards

Rahul

entry.title: SAP HANA Cloud 概况介绍
entry.content:
SAP HANA Cloud 是什么？

SAP HANA Cloud 是一款数据库产品，是一个托管的数据库即服务（DBaaS），基于内存计算技术，为实时分析和智能应用提供数据处理能力

 

SAP 开发 SAP HANA Cloud 的目的是什么？

战略层面

SAP HANA Cloud 是 SAP 云战略的核心组成部分，旨在为应用提供支持，它代表了 SAP 从传统软件供应商向云供应商的战略转型。它位于技术架构的数据层，作为 SAP 云战略的基础数据平台，支撑上层的各种 SAP 应用和第三方应用 

功能层面

一方面，SAP所有业务应用都需要足够强大的数据库来保证性能和安全性，另一方面，SAP客户在开发应用时也会需要足够强大的数据库，SAP HANA Cloud 同时既为SAP应用服务，由作为独立服务直接为客户服务

SAP HANA Cloud 解决了企业在数据处理方面的核心技术挑战：提供统一的数据访问层，简化数据处理，同时整合和协调数据集成到智能应用程序中 。它填补了云端高性能内存数据库服务的功能空白。

 

SAP HANA Cloud 在 SAP 生态中的作用和应用场景

核心功能介绍

SAP HANA Cloud 提供多模型数据处理能力，包括关系型、图形、空间、向量和半结构化数据处理，以及嵌入式机器学习功能 。同时具备内存计算、列式存储、实时分析等技术特性，能够在经过验证的内存速度下处理关键任务数据。

常见使用场景

下一代应用程序数据库：为需要在大数据量上实现超快性能的下一代应用程序提供数据库支持

数据仓库和分析平台：为包括 SAP Datasphere 和自定义数据仓库在内的数据仓库提供支持，通过连接和协调分布式数据到单一、一致的数据模型来支持 SAP Analytics Cloud 等分析工具

应用扩展和现代化：扩展本地应用程序的数据存储和处理能力，例如当大量新用户加入时，或使用基于云的服务扩展现有 SAP 应用程序的功能

 

SAP HANA Cloud 与市场同类产品的区别

产品本身的强大功能

SAP HANA Cloud 具备独特的内存计算技术、多模型数据处理能力和实时分析功能。它提供了关系型数据湖处理大量数据的能力，同时享受云服务的低成本和弹性优势

与 BTP 平台的协同效应

作为 SAP BTP 的核心组件，SAP HANA Cloud 享受平台集成优势，包括统一的开发环境、自动化的软件更新、弹性扩展和服务绑定机制，开发者可以在集成开发环境中开发和建模自定义应用程序。

与 SAP 各应用的协同效应

与SAP 业务数据云BDC协同工作，与SAP生态深度集成，例如HANA Cloud可以通过虚拟表，远程表复制等方式实时获取另一个HANA数据库的数据，这样BTP上的拓展应用就可以以最低的成本获取HANA数据库的实时数据

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法

entry.title: Enhancing Your Understanding of Peru's Inventory and Balance Ledger Report: Updates to Documentation
entry.content:
I’m Maitê, a User Assistance Developer in SAP Globalization, working in the financial area. As part of my role, I’m happy to share with you the latest updates to the documentation for the Peru Inventory and Balance Ledger report in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. Explore the highlights below to discover how these improvements can help with the report!

The Report

The Peru Inventory and Balance Ledger report is currently available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and SAP S/4HANA. The report organizes general ledger balances into subledgers across fourteen electronic accounting books, following Peru's PCGE (Plan Contable General Empresarial) and SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de Administración Tributaria) requirements. 

Recent Documentation Improvements

To help you better understand the Inventory and Balance Ledger report, we have enhanced our documentation with a new page. This addition provides details on specific fields, grouped by configuration settings and characteristics. Our goal is to clarify the relationships between certain fields in the report output and the configurations made by you before running the report.

New page added to the SAP Help Portal

 

Structured Tables for Clarity

We've organized the documentation into five tables:

  • Table 1:  Fields Related to Financial Statement Version (FSV) and G/L Account Hierarchies

This table highlights fields associated with hierarchy configurations from the app Manage Global Hierarchies, focusing on Financial Statement Versions and G/L Account hierarchy types.

  • Table 2: Fields Related to Alternative Chart of Accounts (COA)

This table details fields related to the alternative COA settings used for specific legal reporting requirements in Peru.

  • Table 3: Fields Tax Number Type and Tax Number Related to Alternative Chart of Accounts (COA)

This table specifies details on tax-related fields which are associated with the alternative COA settings.

  • Table 4: Other Fields in the Report

This table provides information about other fields, explaining their data sources and how the system populates them.

  • Table 5: Optional Fields in the Report

Finally, this table lists optional fields included in our solution and explains how they are populated, though they are not required by SUNAT.

Conclusion

We really hope these documentation updates make your journey through the Inventory and Balance Ledger report easier and more efficient. You can find them in the report documentation linked below:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Inventory and Balance Ledger 
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP S/4HANA: Inventory and Balance Ledger

Feel free to explore these tables on the SAP Help Portal and share your questions or feedback in the comments. They are most welcome!

Last but not least, follow the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance community tag for the latest updates. 

Thank you and until next time,

Maitê Bohn

entry.title: Meeting ‘Choai’ Requirements for Japan's Consumer Products Industry
entry.content:
In Japan’s consumer products industry, business transactions often involve a complex hierarchy of partners, known as “Choai.” These hierarchies, spanning first, second, and third levels, are crucial for daily operations, particularly when creating sales orders in bulk for multiple customers. The ability to efficiently maintain and retrieve this hierarchical partner information is essential, as it directly influences downstream processes such as pricing and rebate calculations.

Using Choai Route ID in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Japanese consumer products companies use the Choai Route Master application to maintain Choai Route IDs representing specific partner hierarchies.

When creating a sales order, sales users should have the option to select a Choai Route ID, using which the system can automatically fill in customer and partner details. This will help streamline the process and reduce manual errors.

Extending the Manage Sales Order V2 application

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition supports this localization requirement through developer extensibility in the Manage Sales Order V2 application. By extending this app, companies can retrieve customer and partner data using the Choai Route ID. SAP provides essential development objects for this purpose, including:

  • Behavior Definition (R_SalesOrderTP)
  • Metadata Extension (C_SalesOrderManage)
  • Behavior Projection (C_SalesOrderManage)

These objects enable developers to tailor the application to meet the specific needs of the Japanese consumer products industry.

Implementation Guidance

Detailed, step-by-step instructions on how to extend the Manage Sales Order V2 application to meet this localization requirement are provided in the SAP Note 3607627 and the SAP Help Portal documentation  Creating a Sales Order Using Choai Route ID. 

By utilizing these tools, organizations can ensure their SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system aligns with local business practices and regulatory requirements in Japan's consumer products sector.

Feel free to explore these resources and take the next steps towards optimizing your business processes in Japan's dynamic consumer products market.
